szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.game.world

Class TunnelCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.game.world.TunnelCell

  • public class TunnelCell
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a cell of a horizontal or interconnecting tunnel in the game world. Actors can only move in these cells and a single piece of treasure can only be found within a tunnel cell,

    • Constructor Summary

      • getTunnel

        public HorizontalTunnel getTunnel()
        Gets the horizontal tunnel to which this cell belongs. If this cell is does not belong to any (i.e. if it is part ot a connection between 2 horizontal tunnels), it returns null.
        Returns:
        the horizontal tunnel to which this cell belongs or null if it is not part of a horizontal tunnel.

      • setAtDirection

        public void setAtDirection(Direction dir,
                           TunnelCell pos,
                           java.lang.Object authToken)

      • getCellAtDirection

        public TunnelCell getCellAtDirection(Direction dir)
        Returns the adjacent cell in the direction given, or null, if there is no such cell (meaning there is a wall in that direction).
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to look at.
        Returns:
        The adjacent cell in the direction given or null if there is a wall in that direction.

      • getCellType

        public TunnelCellType getCellType()
        Returns an enum value specifying the configuration of adjacent cells to this cell.
        Returns:
        the type of this tunnel cell according to the configuration of adjacent cells.
        See Also:
        for more info on the meaning of these values.

      • hasNugget

        public boolean hasNugget()
        Checks if there is a nugget or piece of treasure at the current position,
        Returns:
        boolean true if there is a piece of treasure in the current cell | false otherwise.

      • collectNugget

        public void collectNugget(Pipe pipe)

      • isWithinCell

        public boolean isWithinCell(int x,
                            int y)
        Checks if the supplied set of coordinates is within this tunnel cell.
        Parameters:
        x - the horizontal coordinate supplied.
        y - the vertical coordinate supplied.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the coordinates refer to a position within this cell | false otherwise.
